snippet: China’s state-run news media are rapidly growing in Africa, hoping to bolster Beijing’s influence in a region rich in the resources needed to fuel China’s powerhouse industries.
abstract: China’s state-run news media giants are rapidly expanding in Africa and across the developing world, hoping to bolster Beijing’s influence in a region rich in the resources needed to fuel China’s powerhouse industries; Chinese news media is prominent in Nairobi, Kenya, part of a $7 billion expansion campaign based in part on the notion that biased Western news media have painted a distorted portrait of China.

byline.contributor: Reuben Kyama contributed research from Nairobi, and Jacob Fromer from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: China’s state-run news media are rapidly growing in Africa, hoping to bolster Beijing’s influence in a region rich in the resources needed to fuel China’s powerhouse industries.

headline.seo: China’s News Media Are Making Inroads in Africa
headline.main: Pursuing Soft Power, China Puts Stamp on Africa’s News
headline.print_headline: Live From Nairobi, China Puts Its Stamp on News in Africa
